verses.verse: (Salutation) (Acts 1.13; 1 Pet 1.5) Jude, (1 Gk Judas) a servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James, To those who are called, who are beloved (1 Other ancient authorities read sanctified) in (1 Or by) God the Father and kept safe for (1 Or by) Jesus Christ:
May mercy, peace, and love be yours in abundance.

(Occasion of the Letter) (1 Tim 6.12; Titus 1.4) Beloved, while eagerly preparing to write to you about the salvation we share, I find it necessary to write and appeal to you to contend for the faith that was once and for all handed on to the saints.

(Rom 9.22; Gal 2.4; 2 Pet 2.1) For certain intruders have stolen in among you, people who long ago were designated for this condemnation as ungodly, who pervert the grace of our God into debauchery and deny our only Master and Lord, Jesus Christ. (4 Or the only Master and our LORD Jesus Christ)

(Judgment on False Teachers) (Num 14.29; Ps 106.26) Now I desire to remind you, though you are fully informed, once and for all, that Jesus, who saved (5 Other ancient authorities read informed, that the LORD who once and for all saved) a people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed those who did not believe.

(Jn 8.44; 2 Pet 2.4; Rev 20.10) And the angels who did not keep their own position but deserted their proper dwelling, he has kept in eternal chains in deepest darkness for the judgment of the great day.

(Gen 19.24; 2 Pet 2.6) Likewise, Sodom and Gomorrah and the surrounding cities, which, in the same manner as they, indulged in sexual immorality and pursued unnatural lust, (7 Gk went after other flesh) serve as an example by undergoing a punishment of eternal fire.
(2 Pet 2.10) Yet in the same way these dreamers also defile the flesh, reject authority, and slander the glorious ones. (8 Or angels; Gk glories)

(Dan 10.13; Zech 3.2) But when the archangel Michael disputed with the devil and argued about the body of Moses, he did not dare to bring a condemnation of slander (9 Or condemnation for blasphemy) against him but said, “The Lord rebuke you!”
But these people slander whatever they do not understand, and they are destroyed by those things that, like irrational animals, they know by instinct.
(Gen 4.3-8; Num 16.1-3, 31-35; 22.7; 2 Pet 2.15; 1 Jn 3.12) Woe to them! For they go the way of Cain and abandon themselves to Balaam’s error for the sake of gain and perish in Korah’s rebellion.

(Mt 15.13; 1 Cor 11.20ff; Eph 4.14; 2 Pet 2.13) These are blots (12 Or reefs) on your love feasts, while they feast with you without fear, feeding themselves. (12 Or without fear. They are shepherds who care only for themselves) They are waterless clouds carried along by the winds; autumn trees without fruit, twice dead, uprooted;
(Isa 57.20; Phil 3.19; 2 Pet 2.17) wild waves of the sea, casting up the foam of their own shame; wandering stars, for whom the deepest darkness has been reserved forever.
(Gen 5.18; Deut 33.2; Dan 7.10) It was also about these that Enoch, in the seventh generation from Adam, prophesied, saying, “See, the Lord is coming (14 Gk came) with ten thousands of his holy ones,

to execute judgment on all and to convict all the ungodly (15 Other ancient authorities read everyone) of all the deeds of ungodliness that they have committed in such an ungodly way and of all the harsh things that ungodly sinners have spoken against him.”

(2 Pet 2.18) These are grumblers and malcontents; they indulge their lusts; (16 Other ancient authorities read their own lusts) their mouths utter bombastic nonsense, flattering people to their own advantage.
(Warnings and Exhortations) But you, beloved, must remember the words previously spoken by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ,
(1 Tim 4.1; 2 Pet 2.1) for they said to you, “In the last time there will be scoffers, indulging their own ungodly lusts.”
It is these worldly people, devoid of the Spirit, who are causing divisions.
(Eph 6.18; Col 2.7) But you, beloved, build yourselves up on your most holy faith; pray in the Holy Spirit;
(Titus 2.13; 2 Pet 3.12) keep yourselves in the love of God; look forward to the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ that leads to (21 Gk Christ to) eternal life.
And have mercy on some who are wavering;
(Am 4.11; Zech 3.2-5) save others by snatching them out of the fire; and have mercy on still others with fear, hating even the tunic defiled by their bodies. (23 Gk by the flesh)
(Benediction) (Rom 16.25; Eph 3.20; Col 1.22) Now to him who is able to keep you from falling and to make you stand without blemish in the presence of his glory with rejoicing,
(Rom 11.36; 1 Tim 1.17) to the only God our Savior, through Jesus Christ our Lord, be glory, majesty, power, and authority, before all time and now and forever. Amen.
